sen.j: 深泥池（みどろがいけ、みぞろがいけ）は、京都府京都市左京区にある池である。
sen.e: Midoroga-ike Pond (also called Mizoroga-ike Pond) is a pond located in Sakyo-ku Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Midoroga-ike Pond (also called Mizoroga-ike Pond) is a pond located in Sakyo-ku Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Midoroga-ike Pond (also called Mizoroga-ike Pond) is a pond located in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 周囲はおよそ1.5キロメートル、面積はおよそ9ヘクタールで、中央には浮島が存在している。
sen.e: The circumference and area of Midoroga-ike Pond are approximately 1.5 km and 9 hectares, respectively, with a floating island being present at its center.
The circumference and area of Midoroga-ike Pond are approximately 1.5 km and 9 hectares, respectively, with a floating island present at its center.
The circumference and area of Midoroga-ike Pond are approximately 1.5 km and 9 hectares, respectively, with a floating island present at its center.

sen.j: 氷河期からの生き残りとされる生物と温暖地に生息する生物が共存しており、学術的にも貴重な池である。
sen.e: Living things that are presumably remaining survivors from the Ice Age and living things making a warm-temperature region their habitat coexist here, making Midoroga-ike Pond a pond of scientific value.
Living things that are presumably survivors from the Ice Age and those that make the warm-temperature region their habitat coexist here, making Midoroga-ike Pond a pond of scientific value.
Living things that are presumably survivors from the Ice Age and those that make the warm-temperature region their habitat coexist here, making Midoroga-ike Pond a pond of scientific value.

sen.j: 1927年（昭和2年）6月14日に、植物群落が「深泥池水生植物群」として国の天然記念物に指定され、その後1988年（昭和63年）に「深泥池生物群集」として生物群集全体に対象が広げられている。
sen.e: On June 14, 1927, the plant community in this pond was designated as protected species referred to as the 'Midoroga-ike aquiherbosa' and, subsequently, in 1988, the scope of this designation was expanded to include all of the living matters in the pond referred to as the 'Midoroga-ike biological community.'

On June 14, 1927, the plant community in this pond was designated as a protected species referred to as the 'Midoroga-ike aquiherbosa' and, subsequently, in 1988, the scope of this designation was expanded to include all of living matter in the pond, referred to as the 'Midoroga-ike biological community.'

On June 14, 1927, the plant community in this pond was designated as a protected species referred to as the 'Midoroga-ike aquiherbosa' and, subsequently, in 1988, the scope of this designation was expanded to include all of living matter in the pond, referred to as the 'Midoroga-ike biological community.'

sen.j: また、京都府レッドデータブックには「要継続保護」として掲載されている。
sen.e: It is also posted as 'Requires continued conservation' in the Red Data Book of Kyoto Prefecture.
It is also posted as 'Requires continued conservation' in the Red Data Book of Kyoto Prefecture.
It is also posted as 'Requires continued conservation' in the Red Data Book of Kyoto Prefecture.

tit.cmt: 小タイトル用に変更しました。

sen.j: ミツガシワやホロムイソウのような寒冷地に分布する植物や、ジュンサイのような各地に自生するような植物、タヌキモやモウセンゴケのような食虫植物、ヌマガヤやイヌノハナゴケといった高層湿原の構成種など、様々な植物が共存している。
sen.e: Various plants including those normally found in cold climate such as buckbean (Menyanthes trifoliata) and rannoch-rush (Scheuchzeria palustris), those that are grown wild in various regions such as water shields, carnivorous plants such as Utricularia japonica and roundleaf sundew (Drosera rotundifolia), and constituents of high moors such as Moliniopsis japonica (Hack.) Hayata and イヌノハナゴケ are coexisting in Midoroga-ike Pond.
sen.cmt: イヌノハナゴケ － 定訳不明
sen.e: Various plants including those normally found in cold climates such as buckbean (Menyanthes trifoliata) and rannoch-rush (Scheuchzeria palustris), those that are grown wild in various regions such as water shields, carnivorous plants such as Utricularia japonica and roundleaf sundew (Drosera rotundifolia), and constituents of high moors such as Moliniopsis japonica (Hack.) Hayata and イヌノハナゴケ are coexisting in Midoroga-ike Pond.

Various plants including those normally found in cold climates such as buckbean (Menyanthes trifoliata) and rannoch-rush (Scheuchzeria palustris), those that are grown wild in various regions such as water shields, carnivorous plants such as Utricularia japonica and roundleaf sundew (Drosera rotundifolia), and constituents of high moors such as Moliniopsis japonica (Hack.) Hayata and イヌノハナゴケ are coexisting in Midoroga-ike Pond.

sen.j: また、ヨシノボリやスジエビ、クサガメ、ニホンイシガメなども生息している。
sen.e: Additionally, freshwater creatures including fish belonging to the Rhinogobius family and Lake Prawns (Palaemon paucidens) in addition to turtles such as Kusagame (Chinemys reevesii) and Nihonishigame (Mauremys japonica) are making this pond their habitat.
sen.cmt: クサガメ、ニホンイシガメの英名不明
sen.e: Additionally, freshwater creatures including fish belonging to the Rhinogobius family and Lake Prawns (Palaemon paucidens) as well as turtles such as Kusagame (Chinemys reevesii) and Nihonishigame (Mauremys japonica) have made this pond their habitat.

Additionally, freshwater creatures including fish belonging to the Rhinogobius family and Lake Prawns (Palaemon paucidens) as well as turtles such as Kusagame (Chinemys reevesii) and Nihonishigame (Mauremys japonica) have made this pond their habitat.

sen.j: この他、日本に分布する約200種トンボのうち、約50種が生息しているという。
sen.e: It is further said that some 50 species out of approximately 200 species of dragonflies found in Japan live around Midoroga-ike Pond.
Furteher, it is said that some 50 species out of approximately 200 species of dragonflies found in Japan live around Midoroga-ike Pond.
Further, it is said that some 50 species out of approximately 200 species of dragonflies found in Japan live around Midoroga-ike Pond.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 1930年に日本で初めてミズグモが発見された場所であり、本州以南で数少ない生息地の一つである。
sen.e: It is where water spiders were sighted for the first time in Japan in 1930, being one of their very few habitats in Honshu and the south.
It is where water spiders were sighted for the first time in Japan in 1930, being one of their very few habitats in Honshu and the south.
It is where water spiders were sighted for the first time in Japan in 1930, being one of their very few habitats in Honshu and the south.

tit.cmt: 小タイトル用に変更しました。

sen.j: ナガバオモダカ、キショウブなどの植物や、ブルーギルやオオクチバス、ワニガメ、アカミミガメなどの外来種が問題視されている。
sen.e: Foreign species of plants such as grassy arrowhead (Sagittaria graminea) and yellow flags (iris pseudacorus) and freshwater creatures such as bluegills, largemouth bass, alligator snapping turtles and red-eared sliders (Trachemys scripta) are viewed as problematic.

Foreign species of plants such as grassy arrowhead (Sagittaria graminea) and yellow flags (iris pseudacorus) and freshwater creatures such as bluegills, largemouth bass, alligator snapping turtles and red-eared sliders (Trachemys scripta) are viewed as problematic.

Foreign species of plants such as grassy arrowhead (Sagittaria graminea) and yellow flags (iris pseudacorus) and freshwater creatures such as bluegills, largemouth bass, alligator snapping turtles and red-eared sliders (Trachemys scripta) are viewed as problematic.

sen.j: これらは繁殖力が強く、生態系に悪影響を与えているとされ、事実、メダカやタモロコなど、いくつかの在来種が補食関係の変化により姿を消している。
sen.e: It is considered that, since these foreign species have high productive ability, they are negatively affecting the eco-system in that area and, in fact, some of the native species such as killifish and field gudgeon have disappeared due to the changes in predation in the environment.

It is considered that, since these foreign species have high productive ability, they are negatively affecting the eco-system in that area and, in fact, some of the native species such as killifish and field gudgeon have disappeared due to the changes in predation in the environment.

It is considered that, since these foreign species have high productive ability, they are negatively affecting the eco-system in that area and, in fact, some of the native species such as killifish and field gudgeon have disappeared due to the changes in predation in the environment.

sen.j: また、ジュンサイがルアーフィッシングの妨げになるため刈り取られるなどされ、あまり見かけなくなってしまった時期もある。
sen.e: Additionally, egg bonnets were removed to clear the way for lure fishermen and they became a rarity to come across at one point.
Additionally, egg bonnets were removed to clear the way for lure fishermen and at one point became fairly rare.
Additionally, water shields were removed to clear the way for lure fishermen and at one point became fairly rare.
sen.cmt: ジュンサイ→water shieldsとしました。

sen.j: このため、定期的に地元の人や研究者によって在来種の調査や、外来種の駆除を行っている。
sen.e: Local residents and researchers, consequently, are performing studies on native species and exterminating foreign species on the regular basis.
Local residents and researchers, consequently, are performing studies on native species and exterminating foreign species on a regular basis.
Local residents and researchers, consequently, are performing studies on native species and exterminating foreign species on a regular basis.

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄京都市営地下鉄烏丸線 北山駅 (京都府)から徒歩
sen.e: Take Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line to Kitayama Station. Walk from Kitayama Station.
Take Kyoto City Subway Karasuma Line to Kitayama Station. Walk from Kitayama Station.
Within walking distance from Kitayama Station of Kyoto Municipal Subway Karasuma Line
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。

sen.j: 京都市営バス、京都バス 深泥池バス停留所から徒歩
sen.e: Take Kyoto City Bus or Kyoto Bus and get off at Midoroga-ike Bus Stop. Walk from Midoroga-ike Bus Stop.
Take Kyoto City Bus or Kyoto Bus and get off at Midoroga-ike Bus Stop. Walk from Midoroga-ike Bus Stop.
Within walking distance from Midoroga-ike Bus Stop of Kyoto City Bus or Kyoto Bus
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。

sen.j: 池の西側を走る道路の幅は1.5車線～2車線程度と狭い割に交通量が多い。
sen.e: The road running the west side of the pond is only wide enough for 1.5 or 2 car lanes but it is well-travelled.
The road running on the west side of the pond is only wide enough for 1.5 or 2 car lanes but is well-travelled.
The road running on the west side of the pond is only wide enough for 1.5 or 2 car lanes but is well-traveled.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: また、大型の路線バスも通行している。
sen.e: Large buses on a regular route are also running on this road.
Large buses on a regular route are also running on this road.
Large buses on a regular route are also running on this road.

sen.j: 怪談や怪奇現象の舞台としても殊に著名で、古来より現代に至るまで、様々な話が伝えられている。
sen.e: Midoroga-ike Pond is particularly well known as the background for ghost stories and unnatural phenomenon, with various stories having been told about this pond since ancient times to today.
Midoroga-ike Pond is particularly well known as a backdrop for ghost stories and unnatural phenomenon, with various stories having been told about this pond since ancient times to today.
Midoroga-ike Pond is particularly well known as a backdrop for ghost stories and unnatural phenomenon, with various stories having been told about this pond since ancient times to today.
